mainBoard.flavorText: The Kor forsake roots for the winding of the path; forsake voices for the silence of the mind; forsake all else for the poverty of isolation.
mainBoard.name: Nomads en-Kor

rulings.text: It can redirect damage to itself.
It is possible to redirect more damage to a creature than that creature’s toughness.
The ability of this card does not do anything to stop Trample damage from being assigned to the defending player.
You can use this ability as much as you want prior to damage being dealt.
When you redirect combat damage it is still combat damage.

mainBoard.text: {0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Nomads en-Kor this turn is dealt to target creature you control instead.

mainBoard.flavorText: "Our belief shall be the lance that pierces Volrath's heart."
mainBoard.name: Paladin en-Vec
mainBoard.text: First strike, protection from black and from red (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike. It can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black or red.)

mainBoard.name: Soltari Monk

rulings.text: If an attacking creature has multiple evasion abilities, such as shadow and flying, a creature can block it only if that creature satisfies all of the appropriate evasion abilities.
Multiple instances of shadow on the same creature are redundant.
Once a creature has been blocked, that creature remains blocked and will deal and be dealt combat damage even if it gains or loses shadow or if the blocking creature gains or loses shadow.

mainBoard.text:
Protection from black
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)

mainBoard.flavorText: "In Rath," the priest said, "there is even greater need for prayer."
mainBoard.name: Soltari Priest

rulings.text: If an attacking creature has multiple evasion abilities, such as shadow and flying, a creature can block it only if that creature satisfies all of the appropriate evasion abilities.
Multiple instances of shadow on the same creature are redundant.
Once a creature has been blocked, that creature remains blocked and will deal and be dealt combat damage even if it gains or loses shadow or if the blocking creature gains or loses shadow.

mainBoard.text:
Protection from red
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)

mainBoard.name: Soltari Visionary

rulings.text: If the damaged player controls any enchantments, you must choose one to be destroyed. If they do not, nothing happens.
If an attacking creature has multiple evasion abilities, such as shadow and flying, a creature can block it only if that creature satisfies all of the appropriate evasion abilities.
Multiple instances of shadow on the same creature are redundant.
Once a creature has been blocked, that creature remains blocked and will deal and be dealt combat damage even if it gains or loses shadow or if the blocking creature gains or loses shadow.

mainBoard.text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Whenever Soltari Visionary deals damage to a player, destroy target enchantment that player controls.

mainBoard.flavorText:
Count carefully the souls and see that none are lost.
—Vec teaching
mainBoard.name: Soul Warden

rulings.text: Does not trigger on a card on the battlefield being changed into a creature.
The ability will not trigger on itself entering, but it will trigger on any other creature that is put onto the battlefield at the same time.
The life gain is mandatory.
Two Soul Wardens entering at the same time will each cause the other's ability to trigger.

mainBoard.text: Whenever another creature enters, you gain 1 life.

mainBoard.flavorText: Only a matter as vital as destroying Volrath could bring together the reclusive Kor people.
mainBoard.name: Warrior en-Kor

rulings.text: It can redirect damage to itself.
It is possible to redirect more damage to a creature than that creature’s toughness.
The ability of this card does not do anything to stop Trample damage from being assigned to the defending player.
You can use this ability as much as you want prior to damage being dealt.
When you redirect combat damage it is still combat damage.

mainBoard.text: {0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Warrior en-Kor this turn is dealt to target creature you control instead.

mainBoard.flavorText: Out of the blackness and stench of the engulfing swamp emerged a shimmering figure. Only the splattered armor and ichor-stained sword hinted at the unfathomable evil the knight had just laid waste.
mainBoard.name: White Knight
mainBoard.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from black (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black.)

mainBoard.name: Aura of Silence

rulings.text: Aura of Silence affects all opponents in a multiplayer game.

mainBoard.text:
Artifact and enchantment spells your opponents cast cost {2} more to cast.
Sacrifice Aura of Silence: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"An angel appeared in the smoldering skies above the fray, her clothes as flames, her armor as fire."
—"Hymn of Angelfire"
mainBoard.name: Empyrial Armor

rulings.text: The value of X is recalculated constantly, so this card’s bonus varies as the number of cards in your hand varies.

mainBoard.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each card in your hand.

mainBoard.flavorText: The *Weatherlight* dragged the *Predator* behind it, the cradle hauling the casket.
mainBoard.name: Cataclysm

rulings.text: If you control a permanent with more than one type, you can choose that permanent to be the representative of either type. This makes it possible to have more than one creature (or other permanent type) on the battlefield. For example, if you select a creature for your creature and an artifact creature for your artifact, you get to keep both of these creatures.

If you control a permanent with more than one type, you can choose that same permanent for more than one of the choices if you want to. This makes it possible to select an artifact creature as both your artifact and creature, and then select a land and thereby keep only two cards.
The current player makes their choices before the other player. After both players make choices, all the sacrifices are done simultaneously.
The permanents to save are chosen on resolution. You do not choose them when casting the spell.
Each permanent not chosen by a player will be sacrificed. If a permanent has none of the listed types (for example, a Planeswalker with no other types), it can’t be chosen.

mainBoard.text: Each player chooses from among the permanents they control an artifact, a creature, an enchantment, and a land, then sacrifices the rest.

mainBoard.flavorText: The swarm seemed unmoved by the artificial slivers' destruction. "They clearly were not the leaders," Hanna cursed. "I guess we'll have to do this the hard way."
mainBoard.name: Disenchant

rulings.text: This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

mainBoard.name: Tithe

rulings.text: Because the “search” requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don’t have to find the card if you don’t want to.
Counts lands on resolution, not on announcement.

mainBoard.text: Search your library for a Plains card. If target opponent controls more lands than you, you may search your library for an additional Plains card. Reveal those cards, put them into your hand, then shuffle.

sideBoard.flavorText:
"I'm too modest a wizard to reveal the full extent of my abilities."
—Ertai, wizard adept
sideBoard.name: Abeyance

rulings.text: Abeyance does not affect abilities which are not activated, such as static abilities and triggered abilities. It also doesn't stop the declaration of attackers or blockers.
Abeyance never prevents mana abilities from being activated.
Abeyance prohibits activated abilities of cards which are not on the battlefield.
This can't be used as a counterspell. It will have no effect on spells which were on the stack when it was cast, nor on those cast in response to it.

sideBoard.text:
Until end of turn, target player can't cast instant or sorcery spells, and that player can't activate abilities that aren't mana abilities.
Draw a card.

sideBoard.name: Aura of Silence

rulings.text: Aura of Silence affects all opponents in a multiplayer game.

sideBoard.text:
Artifact and enchantment spells your opponents cast cost {2} more to cast.
Sacrifice Aura of Silence: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

sideBoard.name: Cursed Scroll

rulings.text: If you have no cards in hand, you still have to name a card. Then you fail to reveal one (since there aren’t any). Since the named card wasn’t revealed, no damage is dealt.

sideBoard.text: {3}, {T}: Choose a card name, then reveal a card at random from your hand. If that card has the chosen name, Cursed Scroll deals 2 damage to any target.

sideBoard.flavorText: The swarm seemed unmoved by the artificial slivers' destruction. "They clearly were not the leaders," Hanna cursed. "I guess we'll have to do this the hard way."
sideBoard.name: Disenchant

rulings.text: This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

sideBoard.flavorText:
"I regret feeding Kaervek's hunger for power—far better to live with animals innocent of such ambitions."
—Jolrael
sideBoard.name: Spirit Link

rulings.text: The triggered ability triggers when the enchanted creature deals any damage, not only combat damage.

Unlike the lifelink ability, the ability of Spirit Link is a triggered ability that goes on the stack and may be responded to. Notably, if the enchanted creature deals damage at the same time you’re dealt enough damage to reduce your life total to 0 or less, you’ll lose the game before you can gain any life.

sideBoard.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters attached to that creature.)
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.
